page.title: 15Changing Times - 1905
page.content: There were nine streets in 1905.The school was next to the School House. Two classes were held in Noddfa Chapel and five in the school.The infants used slates and the older ones had books.In the terraced houses there was only cold water and paraffin lamps for lighting.Coal fires were used to heat the rooms.The men and boys worked in the pits owned by Guest,Keen and Nettlefold.Women worked on top pit.The wages were poor at 30s a week.The pits were Fochriw,South Tunnel and Cwm Bargoed.The Newport to Brecon Railway was important because it brought in all supplies.People walked everywhere. Dr Davies did his rounds on a horse. People kept pigs and poultry for food. Electricity came in 1917.
